revised_title: The Development of Energy Conservation Principle and Its Impact on Optical Phenomena
tldr: This article discusses the development of the energy conservation principle and its application to optical phenomena, particularly the absorption of light. It highlights the work of George Gabriel Stokes, Anders Jonas Ångström, and other scientists in understanding the interaction of light with matter and the limitations of the undulatory theory. The article also introduces the phenomenon of fluorescence and its relation to energy conservation.
